lead_paragraph: Chevron faces fines of as much as $83 million for an  oil spill this month off the coast of Rio de Janeiro, the authorities said Monday. The fines reflect the government’s anger over Chevron’s handling of the spill. Chevron may also face additional fines and legal penalties, officials said. Haroldo Lima, head of the National Petroleum Agency, said the spill could complicate Chevron’s hopes of gaining access to new offshore exploration areas. Federal investigators said Chevron employees might also face prison terms. Chevron said in a statement that it had not yet received official notice of any fines and would respond if it did.

headline.main: Brazil: Chevron Faces Fines of $83 Million in Oil Spill
